info.title: Orbit Holder API
info.description: Holder API is a SAAS service that Holder entity uses to credential offers to peer entities.

message.example: A required parameter was missing in the request
Invalid API Key included in the request
The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request

name.description: The name or attribute of the credential.

value.description: The value associated with the credential attribute.

credOfferId.description: The unique identifier for the credential issuance process.

credentialStatus.description: The current status of the credential offer.

issuerDid.description: The DID of the issuer of the credential offer.

issuanceDate.description: The date when the credential offer was issued.

credDefId.description: The credential definition ID for the offer.

schemaLedgerId.description: The schema ledger ID associated with the credential offer.

credentialPreview.description: Preview of the credential data being offered.

comments.description: A comment or note about the credential offer.

credFormat.description: The format of the credential being offered.

messageProtocol.description: The protocol message type used for the credential offer.

signature.description: The signature algorithm used to sign the credential offer.

recipientEmail.description: Optional email of the recipient for the credential offer.

recipientName.description: Optional name of the recipient for the credential offer.

declineReason.description: A reason for declining the credential offer.

errorMessage.description: An error message for an issue with the credential offer.

issuanceType.description: The type of issuance process being used for the credential offer.

authorityStatement.description: The authority statement indicating the level of trust for the credential offer.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the credential offer was created.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the credential offer was last updated.

ledgerName.description: The ledger Id of the credential

totalItems.description: Total number of items available across all pages.

itemCount.description: Number of items returned on the current page.

itemsPerPage.description: Number of items to display per page.

totalPages.description: Total number of pages available based on the total items and items per page.

currentPage.description: The current page number in the paginated response.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

credOfferId.description: This is the ID of the credential offer sent by the issuer and the ID of the credential offer received by the holder. The format of this will help the client know whether it is a oob-type.

consent.description: This is an enum to accept or decline offers or proposals or connections received by the recipient. The enum values are (Accept, Decline).

declineReason.description: Reason provided by the recipient when declining the offer.

responseDetails.description: The message indicating the result of the credential offer processing, e.g., success or failure.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful. A true value indicates success.

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

credOfferId.description: This is the ID of the credential offer sent by the issuer and the ID of the credential offer received by the holder. The format of this will help the client know whether it is a oob-type.

createClaim.description: Flag indicating whether the claim is being created. Set to true to initiate the claim creation process.

retainConnection.description: Indicates whether to retain the connection after storing the offer.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

data.description: The data related to the credential offer.

credOfferId.description: This is the ID of the credential offer sent by the issuer and the ID of the credential offer received by the holder. The format of this will help the client know whether it is a oob-type.

responseDetails.description: Message indicating that the credential offer has been successfully deleted.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful. A true value means the credential offer was deleted successfully.

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

credentialId.description: The credential identifier which is being offered by the issuer to the holder

responseDetails.description: The message confirming that the credential was successfully deleted from the wallet.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

name.description: The name of the presentation request.

requestedAttributes.description: The requested attributes for the proof presentation.

requestedPredicates.description: The requested predicates for the proof presentation, including restrictions.

id.description: The unique ID for the proof request.

presentationRequest.description: The details of the presentation request, including requested attributes and predicates.

presentationStatus.description: The current status of the proof request

errorMessage.description: error message if any issue occurred with the proof request.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the proof request was created.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the proof request was last updated.

ledgerName.description: The ledger Id of the credential

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

credDefId.description: Credential Definition ID, identifying the specific credential definition.

schemaLedgerId.description: Schema Ledger ID, identifying the schema of the credential.

credentialId.description: The unique ID of the credential in the database.

credentialReferentId.description: The referent ID, which is a unique identifier for this credential.

credentialStatus.description: The current status of the credential.

attributes.description: The attributes associated with the credential, such as full name and email.

ledgerName.description: The ledger Id of the credential

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

proofId.description: This is the ID for the proof request received by the holder and the proof request sent by the verifier

createClaim.description: Flag indicating whether the claim is being created. Set to true to initiate the claim creation process.

requestedAttributes.description: Requested attributes in the presentation request.

requestedPredicates.description: Requested predicates in the presentation request.

selfAttestedAttributes.description: Self-attested attributes in the presentation request.

responseDetails.description: A message indicating the successful sending of the presentation.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

proofId.description: This is the ID for the proof request received by the holder and the proof request sent by the verifier
The unique ID of the proof that was deleted. This ID identifies the specific proof that has been removed.

status.description: The status of the proof deletion request. It indicates whether the proof was successfully deleted or not.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

proofId.description: This is the ID for the proof request received by the holder and the proof request sent by the verifier

declineReason.description: A reason for declining the proof request. This helps to provide context for the decline decision.

responseDetails.description: A standardized response indicating that the proof request was successfully declined by the holder.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response

url.description: The URL for the out-of-band invitation to accept.

givenName.description: The label for the given name

proofRequestId.description: Proof request ID, if applicable. Provide either this or credOfferId.

credOfferId.description: Credential offer ID, if applicable. Provide either this or proofRequestId.

connectionLess.description: If the 'ConnectionLess' value is 'Yes', then the Aries agent should perform the DID exchange without establishing a connection. If the value is 'No', then the connection should be established before performing the DID exchange.

success.description: Should be “true” in the response body for series 200 response

message.description: Standardized description of the response body for series 200, 300, 400 and 500 response
